com.arcrobotics.ftclib.hardware.motors

Interface Motor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    HardwareDevice
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CRServo, MotorEx, MotorGroup, MotorImpl.CustomMotor, MotorImplEx, SimpleMotorImpl

    public interface Motor
extends HardwareDevice
    Interface for motor devices. Create your own custom motors through the following tutorial:
    1. Create a classfile that implements the Motor interface. Name it something that represents the type of motor you are using. For instance, if you are using a 435 rpm goBILDA Yellow Jacket, then you can name the class: YellowJacket435. This can be done through using: public class YellowJacket435 implements Motor.
    2. Add the motor object as an instance variable. For the regular FTC SDK, this would be DcMotor from com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotor. If you are using re2 from OpenFTC, then you can use something like ExpansionHubMotor org.openftc.revextensions2.ExpansionHubMotor. e.g. private DcMotor motor.
    3. Create the constructor so that it takes in the same type of motor as the object you declared as the parameter. This will have the instance variable reference that object when methods are called.
    4. Implement the methods and create your own if you would like!

      • Methods inherited from interface com.arcrobotics.ftclib.hardware.HardwareDevice

        getDeviceType

    • Method Detail

      • set

        void set(double speed)
        Common interface for setting the speed of a motor. If motor is inverted getInverted(), multiply the speed by -1.
        Parameters:
        speed - The speed to set. Value should be between -1.0 and 1.0.

      • get

        double get()
        Common interface for getting the current set speed of a motor.
        Returns:
        The current set speed. Value is between -1.0 and 1.0.

      • setInverted

        void setInverted(boolean isInverted)
        Common interface for inverting direction of a motor.
        Parameters:
        isInverted - The state of inversion true is inverted.

      • getInverted

        boolean getInverted()
        Common interface for returning if a motor is in the inverted state or not.
        Returns:
        isInverted The state of the inversion true is inverted.

      • disable

        void disable()
        Disable the motor.
        Specified by:
        disable in interface HardwareDevice

      • pidWrite

        void pidWrite(double output)
        Set power to the given output that has been calculated using pid calculations.

      • stopMotor

        void stopMotor()
        Stops motor movement. Motor can be moved again by calling set without having to re-enable the motor.
